Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Our engineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored as soon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aiming to restore your power by 21:00 26/01/2025. If this changes, we will update this message.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QG3062'

Faults.name: RG26 & RG27 Areas

Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault in this area. It's been a busy weekend so far with Storm Éowyn bringing some harsh weather conditions and the weather has been the worst of this winter so far, and has caused a lot of damage to our electricity network. Because of how strong the wind speeds were, it's also been very difficult for our engineers to access damage or make repairs, however, good progress has now been made on this. Our engineers safety is extremely important, so we have had to wait for the weather to improve before we can climb poles and make repairs.

In addition to this, the weather makes travel very difficult too as trees and debris can sometimes be blocking roads or access to our network.

Now the worst of the weather has passed, our engineers have been getting to work on fixing the issues and getting your power back on.

We know you've been without power for some time now, but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted as soon as possible. We'll we working around the clock until every single customer has their power back on.

We have put in place several measures to support our customers, and you can find out more about this here.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you have any immediate medical concerns, rely on medical equipment that needs a power supply, or will struggle to manage during the power cut, please let us know by calling us on 105 and a member of the team will help you.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut today and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

It's been a busy weekend so far with Storm Éowyn bringing some harsh weather conditions and the weather has been the worst of this winter so far, and has caused a lot of damage to our electricity network. Because of how strong the wind speeds were, it's also been very difficult for our engineers to access damage or make repairs, however, good progress has now been made on this. Our engineers safety is extremely important, so we have had to wait for the weather to improve before we can climb poles and make repairs.

In addition to this, the weather makes travel very difficult too as trees and debris can sometimes be blocking roads or access to our network.

Now the worst of the weather has passed, our engineers have been getting to work on fixing the issues and getting your power back on.

We know you've been without power for some time now, but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted as soon as possible. We'll we working around the clock until every single customer has their power back on.

We have put in place several measures to support our customers, and you can find out more about this here.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you have any immediate medical concerns, rely on medical equipment that needs a power supply, or will struggle to manage during the power cut, please let us know by calling us on 105 and a member of the team will help you.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut today and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

We're aware of a fault in this area. It's been a busy weekend so far with Storm Éowyn bringing some harsh weather conditions and the weather has been the worst of this winter so far, and has caused a lot of damage to our electricity network. Because of how strong the wind speeds were, it's also been very difficult for our engineers to access damage or make repairs, however, good progress has now been made on this. Our engineers safety is extremely important, so we have had to wait for the weather to improve before we can climb poles and make repairs.

In addition to this, the weather makes travel very difficult too as trees and debris can sometimes be blocking roads or access to our network.

Now the worst of the weather has passed, our engineers have been getting to work on fixing the issues and getting your power back on.

We know you've been without power for some time now, but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted as soon as possible. We'll we working around the clock until every single customer has their power back on.

We have put in place several measures to support our customers, and you can find out more about this here.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you have any immediate medical concerns, rely on medical equipment that needs a power supply, or will struggle to manage during the power cut, please let us know by calling us on 105 and a member of the team will help you.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut today and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

We're aware of a fault in this area. It's been a busy weekend so far with Storm Éowyn bringing some harsh weather conditions and the weather has been the worst of this winter so far, and has caused a lot of damage to our electricity network. Because of how strong the wind speeds were, it's also been very difficult for our engineers to access damage or make repairs, however, good progress has now been made on this. Our engineers safety is extremely important, so we have had to wait for the weather to improve before we can climb poles and make repairs.

In addition to this, the weather makes travel very difficult too as trees and debris can sometimes be blocking roads or access to our network.

Now the worst of the weather has passed, our engineers have been getting to work on fixing the issues and getting your power back on.

We know you've been without power for some time now, but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted as soon as possible. We'll we working around the clock until every single customer has their power back on.

We have put in place several measures to support our customers, and you can find out more about this here.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you have any immediate medical concerns, rely on medical equipment that needs a power supply, or will struggle to manage during the power cut, please let us know by calling us on 105 and a member of the team will help you.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut today and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

It's been a busy weekend so far with Storm Éowyn bringing some harsh weather conditions and the weather has been the worst of this winter so far, and has caused a lot of damage to our electricity network. Because of how strong the wind speeds were, it's also been very difficult for our engineers to access damage or make repairs, however, good progress has now been made on this. Our engineers safety is extremely important, so we have had to wait for the weather to improve before we can climb poles and make repairs.

In addition to this, the weather makes travel very difficult too as trees and debris can sometimes be blocking roads or access to our network.

Now the worst of the weather has passed, our engineers have been getting to work on fixing the issues and getting your power back on.

We know you've been without power for some time now, but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted as soon as possible. We'll we working around the clock until every single customer has their power back on.

We have put in place several measures to support our customers, and you can find out more about this here.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you have any immediate medical concerns, rely on medical equipment that needs a power supply, or will struggle to manage during the power cut, please let us know by calling us on 105 and a member of the team will help you.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut today and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.

It's been a busy weekend so far with Storm Éowyn bringing some harsh weather conditions and the weather has been the worst of this winter so far, and has caused a lot of damage to our electricity network. Because of how strong the wind speeds were, it's also been very difficult for our engineers to access damage or make repairs, however, good progress has now been made on this. Our engineers safety is extremely important, so we have had to wait for the weather to improve before we can climb poles and make repairs.

In addition to this, the weather makes travel very difficult too as trees and debris can sometimes be blocking roads or access to our network.

Now the worst of the weather has passed, our engineers have been getting to work on fixing the issues and getting your power back on.

We know you've been without power for some time now, but we promise we're doing everything in our power to get things sorted as soon as possible. We'll we working around the clock until every single customer has their power back on.

We have put in place several measures to support our customers, and you can find out more about this here.

The best place to keep track of live updates is right here, and this will be the fastest way to get the latest information about your power cut - it's updated in real time, so if you register for updates here, you'll get notified the moment anything changes.

If you have any immediate medical concerns, rely on medical equipment that needs a power supply, or will struggle to manage during the power cut, please let us know by calling us on 105 and a member of the team will help you.

Once again, we're so sorry for the power cut today and will do everything we can to fix this as quickly and safely as possible. Thank you so much for your patience and support while we work to get your power back on.
